web

Class AppController

  • java.lang.Object
    • web.AppController

  • @Controller
public class AppController
extends java.lang.Object
    Spring MVC controller class. Process all requests from client side.
    Author:
    Aleksandr Gaslov

        @RequestMapping(value="/app")
public java.lang.String app()
        Returns main application view.
        Returns:
        app.jsp view

      • adduser

        @RequestMapping(value="/adduser/",
                produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String adduser(@RequestParam(value="username")
                                                   java.lang.String login,
                                                   @RequestParam(value="password")
                                                   java.lang.String password)
        Returns if entered login exists in data storage. Creates and saves new User with given login and password if given login doesn't exist in data storage.
        Parameters:
        login - entered login
        password - entered password
        Returns:
        if entered login exists in data storage, entered login

      • sendUserName

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/user/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String sendUserName()
        Returns login of authorized user.
        Returns:
        login of authorized user

      • newStudy

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/topic/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String newStudy(@RequestParam(value="topic")
                                                    java.lang.String topic)
        Creates new Study with given topic and returns first cards word of new Study.
        Parameters:
        topic - given topic
        Returns:
        word of first Card of created Study

      • listTopic

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/listTopic/",
                produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listTopic()
        Returns list of available topics.
        Returns:
        list of available topics

      • loadStudy

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/loadStudy/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String loadStudy(@RequestParam(value="studyId")
                                                     java.lang.String id)
        Loads previously saved Study with given id and returns word of next Card of loaded Study
        Parameters:
        id - given study id
        Returns:
        word of next Card of loaded Study

      • listStudy

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/listStudy/",
                produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public java.util.List<Study> listStudy()
        Returns list of available saved Study objects for current user. JSON representation of mentioned list doesn't contain history and user fields.
        Returns:
        list of saved Study objects for current user

      • answer

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/answer/",
                produces="text/plain;charset=UTF-8")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String answer(@RequestParam(value="answer")
                                                  java.lang.String answer)
        Processes user's answer. Returns String claiming if answer is correct and correct translation, if it wasn't.
        Parameters:
        answer - given user's answer
        Returns:
        String claiming if answer is correct and correct translation, if it wasn't

      • nextCard

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/next/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String nextCard()
        Returns word of next card or String claiming that study is over if there is no next card available.
        Returns:
        word of next card or String claiming that study is over if there is no next card available

      • saveStudy

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/saveStudy/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String saveStudy()
        Saves current study and returns id of saved study.
        Returns:
        String containing id of saved Study.

      • listHist

        @RequestMapping(value="/app/listHist/",
                produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public java.util.List<History> listHist()
        Returns list of History objects for current user. JSON representation of mentioned list doesn't contain user field.
        Returns:
        list of History objects for current user.
